clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Well-Being After TBI Through Structured Volunteer Activity
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Well-Being After TBI Through Structured Volunteer Activity

oversight_info.authority: United States: National Institute on Disability Rehabilitation and Research

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this project is to determine if participating in volunteer activity improves the psychological well-being of individuals with traumatic brain injury (TBI).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Satisfaction with Life Scale(SWLS)at post-intervention and follow up points.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-intervention, 3 mos f/u, 6 mos f/u
primary_outcome.description: A five-item, self-rated scale of global life satisfaction. Items are rated on 1-7 point Likert scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Flourishing Scale at post-intervention, and at follow-up points.
secondary_outcome.description: An 8-item self-rated scale of perceived success in areas such as social relationships, self-esteem, and purpose in life. Items are rated on 1-7 point Likert scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Brief Symptom Inventory-18(BSI-18)at post-intervention and at follow-up points.
secondary_outcome.description: An 18-item, self-rated measure of psychological distress. Items are rated on 0-4 Likert scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Scale of Positive and Negative Experience (SPANE)at post intervention and at follow-up points.
secondary_outcome.description: A 12-item, self-rated scale that evaluates positive and negative emotions. It produces a score of positive and negative feelings that can be combined to create a balance score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Purpose in Life subscale of RyffScale of Psychological Well-Being at post-intervention and at follow-up points.
secondary_outcome.description: Consists of nine, self-rated items regarding individual goals, sense of direction, and meaning. This subscale was selected because volunteering has been shown to have a positive relationship with a sense of purpose in life.

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Hair Cortisol test at post-intervention and at follow-up points.
other_outcome.description: This is considered an Exploratory Measure. Cortisol has been explored as a potential biomarker of well-being; lower levels of salivary cortisol have been associated with higher levels of psychological well-being. Recently, reliable and valid methods for measuring long-term cortisol secretion through hair samples have been developed and are being used as biomarkers of chronic stress in multiple medical conditions.

arm_group.description: Participants in this arm will participate in a novel structured volunteering intervention called HOPE - Helping Others through Purpose and Engagement. This intervention involves orientation, training, volunteer placement assistance, and problem solving and support.
Participants who are randomized to the control arm will be offered the HOPE intervention at the conclusion of study.
